title: Judgment Hall
content: Sometimes used in the KJV for the Latin word
, it denotes Pilate’s official residence in Jerusalem; in
it denotes a part of the buildings erected by Herod in Caesarea. In
is translated “common hall” or “governor’s house” (Pilate’s house); in
it is translated “palace” or “Caesar’s court,” meaning the officers of the court before which Paul was tried.
